citations.narrative:
Many of the APHIS Form 7006 Disposition records for the puppies were incomplete. At least ten of the disposition forms
did not include the address of the person to whom the puppy was sold. The forms also did not include the facility's USDA
license number or the USDA license number of the broker to whom some of the dogs were sold.
It's important to document all required disposition information to allow for animal movements to be tracked and ensure
that individuals that require a USDA license are appropriately licensed.
Each dealer shall maintain disposition records which fully and correctly disclose all the required information as included
on the APHIS Form 7006.
Correct by March 28, 2023.

There are two primary enclosures in a state of disrepair. In the rear puppy enclosure, located at the office, there is an
approximately 6" x 8" hole in the elevated flooring. The hole appears to be filled with shavings but still could allow for
puppies to fall into the void. Additionally, in one of the enclosures housing an adult German Shepherd, there is an
approximately 8" x 10" circular hole in the aluminum wall of the outdoor run. This area has exposed insulation and sharp,
rough metal edges.
Failure to maintain primary enclosures can allow for holes or sharp points which can result in injury, entrapment, or
escape of the animals.
Primary enclosures must be kept in good repair to protect the animals from injury.
Correct by April 4, 2023.

The licensee is not consistently maintaining medical records for his adult dogs and puppies. The vaccination and
deworming records for approximately half of the puppies were not available during the inspection. Additionally, the
licensee is not recording the distemper or parvovirus vaccinations, deworming, or treatments of the adult dogs.
Failure to document and maintain medical records for the dogs and puppies can make it difficult to verify that the Program
of Veterinary Care is being followed as written and that the dogs are receiving the appropriate preventative care and
treatments.
Medical records for dogs must contain the name of all vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of
administration.
Correct by March 28, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section
